title: [Large-scale] Instructional Design Utilizing Segmented Videos for Basketball Tactics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic basketball rules and individual technical skills
context.additional_context: Learners participate in real-time classes via personal devices, with morning sessions optimized for learning effectiveness; tactical comprehension is enhanced through segmented video content (macro/micro segments)

learning_goals: Learners can identify basic tactical patterns (five or more) in basketball game videos with 80% accuracy within four weeks.
Learners can apply tactics learned through split-video simulations with a 70% or higher success rate in simulation tests.
Learners can explain and provide feedback on tactical decision-making processes at least three times through peer and formative assessments.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.)
Quiz and Feedback System (Google Forms, Mentimeter, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
